skillTree.localised_description: The largest Stegadon to be found anywhere, Zlaaq has served Lord Mazdamundi faithfully for almost five hundred years.

attributes.bullet_text: Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fire while on the move.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

ui_effects.localised_text: Winds of Magic effects are increased by every affected unit

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: Passed on to their Skink attendants, the Slann provide guidance and direction to those nearest them.

skillTree.localised_description: With sudden clarity, the warriors understand their exact function within the Great Plan, and fight with unwavering resolve.

skillTree.localised_description: Cold, merciless, without pity, obeying only logic. Hardened against magic's ill-effects.
Within the Slann's gaze shines the cold-blooded scrutiny of the Old Ones.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: "Everywhere we shine, death and life burn into something new…"
The Mage-Priest's thought patterns are so alien that they are even beyond the perception of enemy Wizards.
When wounded, the Slann's sheer force of will literally recombines his body.
The power of the Old Ones, stored for future use so that - at precisely the right time - the Great Plan may be advanced.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +10

skillTree.localised_description: Contemplation is the path to alignment, to the correct interpretation of the Great Plan.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -20
	(enemy armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: All shall be one, as it is written.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +20
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: Cold, merciless, without pity, obeying only logic. Hardened against magic's ill-effects.
Through millennia of study, total mastery over magic may be attained.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Tireless in their obedience.
Those who oppose the Great Plan will be destroyed.
To be prepared is the Slann way.
Must go faster, must go faster!
Ancient rage, when directed to action, is unstoppable.
The older, more experienced Lizardmen are stronger than the fresh spawns.

effects.description:
Melee and missile weapon damage: +1% per rank achieved
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Slann collective consciousness is the most powerful magical force in the world.
The violent winds abate at the behest of the venerable Slann.
Some must fall so that others will carry out the Great Plan.
From the power of the Old Ones, a small amount of protection can be forged.
The Lizardmen know what they do, and they do it with perfect obedience.
The powerful Slann's mind is connected even to the lesser castes. The connection strengthens with age.

effects.description:
Spell resistance: 1% per rank achieved
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -10% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -15% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: The power generated by the overarching Geomantic Web can also be used to nourish the Saurus on the march.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Life in the jungle means knowing the difference between which flora can heal and what, if ingested, will kill you.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

factionEffects.localised_description: Lord Mazdamundi is the oldest and most powerful of the living Slann Mage-Priests. At the Dawn of Creation, he was instructed by none other than Lord Kroak himself.

nodes.localised_description: Woe to the warm-bloods who would despoil our realm, for their craving for trinkets and baubles drives them deeper into lands forbidden to them. Cast them out, show them no pity, feed their carcasses to the beasts of the jungle and leave their bones to bleach upon the golden shores of our land. Let them see that it is folly to intrude upon the domains of the Lizardmen. (Mazdamundi campaign only skill)

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Blessing of Hexoatl"
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)
